channel.title: Turning off PK?!

item.title: Turning off PK?!
item.dc:creator: @Ill_Pk_You Ill Pk You
item.description:
@Ill_Pk_You wrote:

[quote=“jc22493, post:4, topic:280548”]public class client extends Player implements Runnable { public boolean inFunPk() { if (absX >= 3331 && absX <= 3359 && absY >= 3243 && absY <= 3259) { return true; else return false; } }[/quote]

If I do that, the command doesn’t work and FunPk still works.

item.title: Turning off PK?!
item.dc:creator: @Ill_Pk_You Ill Pk You
item.description:
@Ill_Pk_You wrote:

Err, sure.

if(command.startsWith("onfunpk") && (connectedFrom.equals("localhost") || playerRights > 1)) { FunPk = true; sM("You turned on Fun Pk."); yell("["+playerName+"] - turned on FunPk Pking (::offfunpk and ::onfunpk for admins)."); } if(command.startsWith("offfunpk") && (connectedFrom.equals("localhost") || playerRights > 1)) { FunPk = false; sM("You turned off Fun Pk."); yell("["+playerName+"] - turned off FunPk Pking (::offfunpk and ::onfunpk for admins)."); }

Read full topic

item.title: Turning off PK?!
item.dc:creator: @Ill_Pk_You Ill Pk You
item.description:
@Ill_Pk_You wrote:

Well, I’m so far from making 2 commands, which is Turning off Pk and Turning it back on via command. (Fun Pk) But I get the error;

client.java:24: missing return statement } ^ 1 error Press any key to continue . . .

I’ve made the boolean

FunPk = true

I also declared it in the FunPk boolean, (Not same name)

Here is the boolean;

public class client extends Player implements Runnable { public boolean inFunPk() { if (absX >= 3331 && absX <= 3359 && absY >= 3243 && absY <= 3259) { return true; } else if (FunPk = !true) { return false; } }

Anyone who figures out how I can get no errors, I’ll give you some REP :).

Thanks in advance

Read full topic
